recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups boiling water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup brewed coffee"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup vanilla citrus liqueur (tuaca)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups powdered sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) container mascarpone cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup vanilla citrus liqueur (tuaca)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (14 ounce) package ladyfinger cookies"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon grated semisweet chocolate"}]

Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare filling: Combine powdered sugar, mascarpone cheese, 1/4 cup tuaca, and vanilla extract in a bowl; whip with the whisk attachment of an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually add whipping cream and whip until soft peaks form."},{"recipe_directions":"Continue syrup: Mix coffee and tuaca into the sugar-water mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"Assemble tiramisu: Line the bottom of a 9x13-inch glass baking dish with ladyfingers. Pour 1/2 of the syrup over top, then layer with 1/2 of the filling. Add another layer of ladyfingers and cover with remaining syrup and filling. recipe_card: Tiramisu All'estate Semplice 1 Rating

Toss to coat the berries."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine mascarpone cheese and heavy cream carefully in a separate bowl using a spoon or whisk. Add 2 tablespoons sugar and vanilla extract. Beat mixture together in a bowl using an electric mixer until creamy and smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix the remaining 2 tablespoons wine and peach tea together in a separate bowl. Dip each ladyfinger in the liquid once until coated but not extra soggy."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon a dollop of the mascarpone cream onto the bottom of a serving cup. Arrange a few ladyfingers to cover the bottom. Layer berries on top. Dollop on more mascarpone cream. Repeat to make a second layer. Repeat with each serving cup."},{"recipe_directions":"Rap the bottom of each cup against the counter to expel excess air bubbles. recipe_card: Rich Tiramisu 23 Ratings

Spread 1/2 of mixture over soaked lady fingers; cover with second 1/2 of soaked lady fingers and cover evenly with remaining mascarpone cheese mixture. Sprinkle top with cocoa powder. Refrigerate at least 3 hours."}]

recipe_card: Cheater's Tiramisu 2 Ratings

Pour into the prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 29 to 34 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely, about 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Poke 12 holes in the cooled cake with the base of a serving spoon or any utensil that has a rounded bottom."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip whipping cream, adding sugar and vanilla when it's about halfway whipped; you want it to hold its shape, but don't overwhip."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour coffee over the cake, then immediately spread whipped cream evenly over top. Dust with cocoa powder, covering it completely. Cut and serve or chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve."}]

recipe_card: Salted Caramel Tiramisu

Let cool, 5 to 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip cream in a bowl using an electric mixer until it holds stiff peaks, 3 to 4 minutes. Fold 1/2 of the whipped cream into the cooled mascarpone mixture. Fold in remaining cream until fully incorporated; whipped cream will deflate a little."},{"recipe_directions":"Dip 1/2 of the ladyfingers very quickly into the espresso mixture. Whisk cream slowly into the caramel and let simmer over medium-low heat until smooth, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat. recipe_card: Emily's Famous Tiramisu 133 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"5  eggs, separated"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup confectioners' sugar for dusting"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup boiling water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup strong brewed coffee"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup rum"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) container mascarpone cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup dark rum"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, grated"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ cup confectioners' sugar for dusting"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"In a medium bowl, whip egg yolks and 1/4 cup of sugar with an electric mixer until thick and pale. In a separate bowl, whip egg whites (with clean beaters) to soft peaks. Gradually sprinkle in the remaining 1/2 cup sugar while whipping to medium stiff peaks. Fold the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites. Gently fold in the flour and 1 teaspoon vanilla. The batter should be thick and pale yellow."},{"recipe_directions":"Trace two 9 inch circles onto the parchment paper using a cake pan as a guide. Spread or pipe batter to completely fill inside the lines of the circles. Batter should be about 1/2 inch tall."},{"recipe_directions":"Load the remaining batter into a pastry bag fitted with a half inch tip or hole. Draw parallel lines onto another piece of parchment that are 3 inches apart. Pipe the batter back and forth just between the lines in a compressed S motion, until you run out of batter. This is the part that wraps around the outside of the cake. (It helps to have it in one piece, but you can pipe individual fingers using the guidelines drawn on the paper, if you prefer.) There may be extra."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in preheated oven 10 to 15 minutes, until firm but not browned. Remove from the oven and dust generously with confectioners' sugar. Set aside to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the syrup, stir together 1 cup sugar, boiling water, coffee and 1/4 cup rum until sugar is dissolved. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the filling, combine mascarpone, 2 cups confectioners' sugar, dark rum and 1 teaspoon vanilla in a large bowl. Whisk together until completely smooth, scraping the bottom of the bowl to remove any lumps. Gradually whisk in the heavy cream. Whip with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Stop whipping when the mixture shows the first sign of graininess."},{"recipe_directions":"To assemble, line the sides of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment or waxed paper. Place one of the ladyfinger rounds in the bottom of the pan. Brush generously, but do not soak completely, with syrup. Place the 3-inch high ladyfinger strips around the inside edge of the pan, so that the sides are completely covered. Brush generously with syrup."},{"recipe_directions":"Spread half of the filling mixture over the first ladyfinger round in the pan. Place the remaining ladyfinger round on top of the filling. Soak the second ladyfinger round with syrup until it cannot take any more. Spread the remaining filling over that and smooth the top. Sprinkle with grated chocolate. Refrigerate at least 4 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"To serve, remove the sides of the pan and carefully remove the parchment or waxed paper from the outside of the cake. Dust with confectioners' sugar just before serving."}]

recipe_card: Gingerbread Butterscotch Trifle 3 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips"},{"recipe_tags":"In The Raw® Sweeteners"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 tablespoons butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup Sugar In The Raw®"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup Stevia In The Raw®"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup molasses"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon sea salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup boiling water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup Stevia In The Raw®"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ teaspoon sea salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon Sugar In The Raw®"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons Stevia In The Raw®"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-inch square baking pan. With a stand or hand mixer beat butter with Sugar In The Raw® and Stevia In The Raw® until creamy. Beat in molasses and egg. Beat in flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, and salt on low speed. Then mix in water on low speed, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool completely and then cut into 1-inch cubes."},{"recipe_directions":"To make butterscotch, melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add brown sugar, Stevia In The Raw®, cream, and salt and whisk until combined. Bring to a gentle boil and cook for 5 minutes, whisking occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Cool to room temperature."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl beat cream, Sugar In The Raw® and Stevia In The Raw® on high speed until stiff peaks form - about 1 minute. Keep whipped cream cold until ready to assemble trifle."},{"recipe_directions":"To assemble, distribute half the gingerbread cubes amongst 10 individual serving dishes or jars. Top with some of the butterscotch sauce and whipped cream then top with the remaining gingerbread cubes, butterscotch, and whipped cream."}]

recipe_card: Red, White, and Blue Trifle

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch glass baking pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat eggs until very light, about 3 minutes. Pour into the prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Let cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"In the meantime, make the custard. Whisk sugar, flour, and salt together in a saucepan over low heat. Add milk and eggs. Cook, stirring frequently, until custard thickens, about 25 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla extract. Store custard in a glass container in the refrigerator until ready to use."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine cream and sugar; whip until stiff peaks form. Set aside in the refrigerator."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut the cake into 2- or 3-inch squares. Place a layer of cake on the bottom of a trifle dish. Add enough custard to cover the cake. Arrange remaining berries decoratively on top."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover trifle with plastic wrap and chill until ready to serve, at least 30 minutes."}]

Discard solids in sieve."},{"recipe_directions":"Fill a large saucepan with 2 inches of water; bring to a simmer. Set metal bowl on top; whisk puree until thickened and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center registers 170 degrees F (77 degrees C), about 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place metal bowl on a towel on a flat work surface. Sprinkle a few fresh raspberries over the peaches. Dollop a layer of whipped topping, then repeat layers until all cake and fruit has been used. Finish trifle with a layer of whipped topping. recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl on medium speed with an electric mixer until until soft peaks form, about 3 minutes. Slowly add sugar, cornstarch, and cream of tartar and continue beating on high speed until stiff, glossy peaks form, 3 to 5 minutes. Add vanilla extract and salt and beat until combined, about 30 seconds."},{"recipe_directions":"Scoop the meringue with a spring-hinged scoop onto the prepared baking sheet and shape into individual rounds about 3 inches in diameter. Use the back of a spoon to create an indentation in the center of the meringue."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the meringue is dry to the touch, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Transfer the parchment with the meringues on it to a wire rack and allow to cool. Once meringues are cool to the touch, remove from parchment and place directly on the rack to cool completely, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"When ready to serve, top each meringue with whipped cream and garnish with fresh berries."}]

recipe_card: Pavlova with Winter Fruits 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg whites, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup superfine sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon orange blossom water (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  lemons, zested and juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large egg yolks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch sea salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons coconut oil, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon orange blossom water (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  pink grapefruit, peeled and sliced crosswise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  orange, peeled and sliced crosswise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  ripe Fuyu persimmon, peeled and thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  pomegranate, seeded"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Invert a small bowl onto the parchment paper and trace the rim with a pencil. Repeat twice more. Flip parchment paper over."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks begin to form. Gradually add white sugar, with the mixer running. Whisk superfine sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl. Gradually beat into the meringue. Continue beating meringue until stiff, glossy peaks form. Beat in orange blossom water and vinegar."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon meringue into the traced circles. Make the borders higher than the center, to leave room for the filling."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake meringues in the preheated oven until firm and dry to the touch, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, make the lemon curd. Fill a medium saucepan with 1 inch of water and bring to a bare simmer."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, egg yolks, and salt together in a glass bowl. Set the bowl over the simmering water. Cook, whisking constantly, until curd foams, then thickens, about 10 minutes. Remove the bowl from the simmering water. Gradually whisk in coconut oil until melted and incorporated."},{"recipe_directions":"Strain the curd through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids left in the strainer. Press a sheet of plastic wrap directly onto the surface to prevent a skin from forming. Transfer to the refrigerator."},{"recipe_directions":"Turn off oven and keep meringues inside until completely dry, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine heavy cream, confectioners' sugar, and orange blossom water in a bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until soft peaks form."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon lemon curd into the center of the cooled meringues. Mound whipped cream over the curd. Arrange grapefruit, orange, and persimmon slices on top. Sprinkle pomegranate seeds over the top."}]

recipe_card: Meringue Cake with Whipped Cream and Raspberries 12 Ratings
recipe_name: Meringue Cake with Whipped Cream and Raspberries
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup granulated sugar, plus"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  large egg whites, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pint fresh raspberries"},{"recipe_ingredients":"NOTE: You will need parchment paper for this recipe."}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"The night before serving, adjust oven rack to lower-middle position and heat oven to 500 degrees."},{"recipe_directions":"Line a lipped cookie sheet (approximately 12 by 18 inches) with parchment paper. Trace two side-by-side rectangles - about 5 inches by 12 or 13 inches - on the paper. Crumple the paper, then smooth it out again and line the bottom of the pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together confectioner's sugar, 1/2 cup granulated sugar and cornstarch. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In the bowl of a mixer, beat egg whites and cream of tartar until they turn from foamy to white and beaters just start to leave a trail. On low speed, add sugar mixture, a heaping tablespoon at a time. Increase speed to medium-high and beat to the consistency of marshmallow cream, 2 to 3 minutes longer."},{"recipe_directions":"Just before forming meringues, flick water onto parchment with fingertips. Divide meringue in half, spooning two or three mounds down each traced rectangle. Use a rubber spatula, or a cake decorator's metal offset spatula, to fill in and even out rectangles."},{"recipe_directions":"Set meringues in oven, close door and turn oven off (but leave oven light on). Let meringues dry overnight. Remove, then carefully set a wire rack or cookie sheet over meringues. Invert; peel off parchment and turn right side up. (It's OK if edges chip.) Wrap in foil and set aside until ready to proceed."},{"recipe_directions":"No more than two hours before serving, whip cream to soft peaks, beating in remaining sugar and the vanilla. Set one meringue on a platter. Spread with half the cream and sprinkle on half the berries. Repeat with remaining meringue, cream and berries. Refrigerate, uncovered, until ready to serve."}]

recipe_card: Chocolate Pavlova 27 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (1 ounce) squares bittersweet chocolate, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups fresh strawberries, hulled and halved"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 ounce) square bittersweet chocolate, melted"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat together egg whites, salt, and cream of tartar to soft peaks in a large bowl. Beat in sugar, about three tablespoons at a time, until stiff and glossy peaks form. Sift cocoa and cornstarch over egg whites, and gently fold in. Gently fold in vinegar, vanilla, and melted chocolate."},{"recipe_directions":"Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, and spread the meringue into an eight inch circle. Bake in the center of the oven for 1 1/2 hours until the outside is crispy and the center is soft. Using a metal spatula, loosen the meringue from the parchment paper, and remove to cool on a wire rack. Allow to cool completely, about one hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip cream with the sugar, and spread over the meringue. Arrange strawberries decoratively over the top, and drizzle with chocolate."}]

recipe_card: Lemon Blueberry Pavlova 9 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Prepare lemon curd filling: Cut butter into small pieces and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Separate eggs, placing yolks in a heat-proof bowl and whites in glass, metal, or ceramic bowl. Cover egg whites and leave on the counter to come to room temperature for the meringue."},{"recipe_directions":"Add lemon zest, salt, sugar, and lemon juice to egg yolks. Whisk until thoroughly combined."},{"recipe_directions":"Add 1 to 2 inches water to a saucepan over low heat; bring to a simmer. Place bowl of filling over the simmering water. Lay plastic wrap on top of the filling, pressing down so it doesn't develop a skin, and place in the refrigerator until well chilled, 2 to 3 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a silicone liner, such as Silpat®. Lightly spray with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Begin meringue: Mix cornstarch into sugar and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Add cream of tartar, lemon juice, and vanilla to the reserved egg whites. Whisk with a large whisk until very soft peaks form, about 3 minutes. Whisk in sugar mixture, 2 tablespoons at a time, whisking about 1 minute between each addition, until incorporated. When all sugar mixture has been added, continue to whisk until relatively stiff peaks form and whites are firm enough to hold their shape."},{"recipe_directions":"Use 2 spoons or a piping bag to transfer whites onto the prepared baking sheet, forming a ring of dollops about 8 or 9 inches across. Let meringue sit in the oven until its cooled completely, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, prepare blueberry sauce: combine 1 cup blueberries, sugar, and water in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a simmer. Place in the refrigerator until fully chilled, about 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Very carefully transfer cooled meringue to a serving platter using 2 large spatulas if necessary; you may get some cracks but that's okay.
